title.narrative: Climate Resilient and Inclusive Green Growth for Poor Rural Communities: Accelerating Implementation in the Agriculture Value Chain (KOICA)

description.narrative: Climate Resilient and Inclusive Green Growth for Poor Rural Communities: Accelerating Implementation in the Agriculture Value Chain
Mainstreaming climate resilience and inclusive green growth in the agricultural sector of Oriental Mindoro, Philippines

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04546 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: Develop and implement policies enhancing climate resilience and productivity of the agricultural value chain.

description.narrative: Copy of local policies submitted to LGUs

title.narrative: Activity 1.2.1: Determine and analyze challenges in the agricultural value chain due to climate change based on information generated by CVRIS. - Number of analytical and policy reports on local agriculture sector

Activity 1.2.2: Prepare draft local policies addressing the challenges in the agricultural value chain and present them to the concerned LGUs and NGAs for approval. - Number of draft policies prepared
Activity 1.2.3: Prepare action plans and implement approved policies. - Number of action plans prepared
Climate vulnerability and risk information system (CVRIS) for agriculture value chain in Oriental Mindoro designed and implemented.

description.narrative: Copy of reports generated by CVRIS

title.narrative: Activity 1.1.1: Baseline assessment of climate vulnerability and risk and socioeconomic data of the agriculture sector. - Baseline assessment report vetted with LGUs and concerned NGAs

Activity 1.1.2: Organize Technical Working Groups to engage in baseline assessment and other project activities via MoU signing, provision of IT equipment, and workshops. - Number of Technical Working Groups organized

Activity 1.1.3: Design CVRIS database framework and visualization tool and gather relevant data based on the analysis of status quo, benchmarking of international cases, and consultation workshops. - CVRIS operational framework developed

Activity 1.1.4: Analyze climate vulnerability / risk and visualize them through CVRIS, linking them to information platform of the Provincial Government. - Final CVRIS available online - Number of final CVRIS operations manual
Design, financing, and operationalization of micro-enterprises and a Provincial Agricultural Center (PAC) in Oriental Mindoro

description.narrative: Financial statements of beneficiary agri micro-enterprises

title.narrative: Annual household income of farmers supplying beneficiary micro-enterprises and the PAC (%)
Annual revenue of beneficiary micro-enterprises (%)
Number of farmers supplying beneficiary micro-enterprises and the PAC (%)
Capacity development activities to promote profitable, climate resilient, inclusive and green agriculture value chain
Investment and technical assistance for 5 micro-enterprises
Investment and technical assistance for Provincial Agricultural Center (PAC)

description.narrative: Copy of post-training and post-workshop completion reports
Increase in annual production volume as stated in the micro-enterprise financial statements
License-To-Operate (LTO) issued by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA)

title.narrative: Activity 2.2.1: Finalize baselines for the supply of raw materials, investment plan and growth strategy for participating agri micro-enterprises. - Number of baselines for the supply of raw materials, investment plan and growth strategy for five agri micro-enterprises completed

Activity 2.2.2: Develop a business plan and PP&E development for participating micro-enterprises. - Business plan prepared upgraded (5) - Technical Design and Bills of Quantities (BOQ) for PP&E developed (5)
Activity 2.2.3: Finance and implement improvements to PP&E for participating micro-enterprises through procurement. - Number of improved facilities with upgraded processing equipment (5)

Activity 2.2.4: Strengthen engagements upstream (farmers) and downstream (buyers) of the value chain, and monitor/oversee the operationalization of improved facilities and processes. - Number of micro-enterprises using farmer management software (5) - Number of trade fair attended per year per micro-enterprise (8)\
Activity 2.3.1: Conduct a full-fledged feasibility study of the PAC. - Number of feasibility study completed, in consultation with PSAG, micro-enterprises, and farmers (1)

Activity 2.3.2: Finance the PAC’s construction and installation of processing equipment. - Business model and business plan confirmed (1) - Construction of physical structure and installation of processing equipment completed (1)
Activity 2.3.3: Oversee the operationalization and monitor performance promoting sustained utilization of PAC. - Composition of PAC management team completed (1) - Secure FDA-LTO license (1)
Activity 3.1.1: Conduct capacity needs assessment and develop training modules. - Number of training modules developed (8)
Activity 3.1.2: Conduct training activities for local government units (subjects include climate change and green growth
Activity 3.1.3: Conduct training activities for farmers, agri cooperatives/ micro enterprises, and relevant association (subjects include climate change, green growth, and agri business

Activity 3.1.4: Provide benchmarking cases and mentoring services to stakeholders via on-site consulting, international learning mission(s) (to Korea), and post-learning monitoring session. - Number of program on benchmarking case study (1) - 70% of participants satisfied with training
Activity 3.1.5: Conduct post-learning monitoring sessions and summarize project experiences and lessons learned. - Number of project documentation report (1)
